node.title: Sweden's Parliament approves first female Prime Minister
node.alt: A close up of Magdalena Andersson delivering a speech in parliament.
node.description: Social Democrat leader Magdalena Andersson's approval is a milestone for Sweden, and means three out of five NordicÂ countries have female leaders.
node.content:
["Sweden's Parliament has confirmed Social Democrat leader Magdalena Andersson as the country's first female Prime Minister.", "Ms Andersson, 54, won approval as Prime Minister after reaching a last-minute deal with the former communist Left Party.", "The development has marked a milestone for Sweden, viewed for decades as one of Europe's most progressive countries, but which had yet to have a woman in the top political post.\u00a0", "Sweden has lagged neighbour Norway by 40 years in appointing a female prime minister.", "Finland got its first female premier in 2003 and Denmark in 2011.", "Ms\u00a0Andersson's appointment means that three-fifths\u00a0of Nordic countries now have female leaders.\u00a0", "\"I know what this means for girls in our country,\" a visibly emotional Ms Andersson said.", "", "
The development has marked a milestone for Sweden and was welcomed by the leaders of the left and centre left party.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Erik Simander)
", "Ms Andersson took over as leader of the Social Democrats from outgoing prime minister Stefan Lofven earlier this month.", "Mr\u00a0Lofven had been in power for seven years, with Ms Andersson as finance minister.", "In a speech to Parliament, Amineh Kakabaveh, an independent lawmaker who supported Andersson, noted that Sweden is currently celebrating the 100th anniversary of a decision to introduce universal and equal suffrage in the Scandinavian country.", "\"There is something symbolic in this decision.\"", "
Andersson set to form two-party minority
", "In the 349-seat Riksdag, 117 lawmakers voted yes to Ms Andersson, 174 rejected her appointment while 57 abstained and one lawmaker was absent.", "Under the Swedish Constitution, prime ministers can be named and govern as long as a parliamentary majority \u2014 a minimum of 175 lawmakers \u2014 is not against them.", "Ms Andersson likely will form a two-party, minority government with her Social Democrats and the Green Party.", "She sought to secure the backing of the two smaller parties that supported Sweden's previous centre-left, minority government led by Mr Lofven \u2014 the Left Party and the Center Party.", "Both abstained from voting against her.", "After days of talks, Ms Andersson and the Left Party reached a deal to win the latter's support.", "The deal focused on pensions, meaning a supplement of up to 1,000 kronor ($153) for about 700,000 pensioners on low incomes.", "Sweden's next general election is scheduled for September 11, 2022.", "Wires/ABC"]
